job_description: Quality Analyst,Intellectual Property - job post TikTok (part of ByteDance) 99 reviews Los Angeles, CA $62,400 - $124,344 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $62,400 - $124,344 a year Job Type Full-time Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. As a member of the US + CA Legal Policy Operations (LPO) team, you will be integral in ensuring that TikTok is a safe and trustworthy place for our community. LPO is responsible for balancing corporate compliance responsibilities with the appropriate operational safeguards to protect our users’ rights. Within and across each vertical, we work together to develop efficient workflows that mitigate legal risk. We are here to strike a scalable balance between what the law requires and what is operationally feasible to protect our users. We are here to help all our Safety organization and wider company colleagues ensure that we are sustaining an equitable platform that inspires creativity across all markets. Our team is a group of specialists covering Privacy, Intellectual Property & Identity, Law Enforcement Response, and Legal Investigations. As a Quality Analyst, you will become a quality expert and work to support our Intellectual Property and Identity team through quality assessments, continuous improvement initiatives and much more. Our team must rely on accurate quality measurement and data-driven decisions to sustain scalable operations focused on operational maturity, consistency, and compliance. Quality includes measuring not only individual operator performance but also evaluating the efficacy of our policies and processes to ensure general compliance. This role will require critical thinking, creative solutions, strong communications skills, and excellent problem-solving. You will be working with a variety of stakeholders across the globe, including Training and Documentation, Policy and Process, Tooling and Legal to ensure that Legal Policy Operations remains a vibrant and operationally mature organization. This is a hugely exciting opportunity to join a rapidly expanding international team, and a unique chance to be one of the first members of the Quality team. This position will be full-time and will be based in our Los Angeles, CA location. Responsibilities: Conduct quality assessments encompassing complex policies and workflow processes for the US and Canada Intellectual Property and Identity team Remain up to date on relevant workflow changes, operational guidelines, and policy updates Track/flag trends and patterns within assessments and cascade back to Performance Insights Manager Use quantitative & qualitative research methods to perform post hoc root cause analyses on designated high priority escalations Create and present case reviews that adapt to various audiences (leadership, specialists, etc.) to establish a unified message and an understanding of events and root causes Identify and recommend improvements to policies, processes, systems, and products that mitigates risk to TikTok Support the operational team on its quality initiatives, create data- driven insights on escalation trends, and maintain feedback loops to leverage these trends to mitigate risk Monitor quality assurance related metrics, familiar with data statistics and analysis Collaborate closely with data analytics team and engineering team to continually improve on tooling needs for QA metrics and data analysis Provide constructive feedback to Intellectual Property and Identity Team members and management regarding quality of work highlighting any identified risks Qualifications 1+ years of relevant experience in quality assurance, reporting, analytics and/or operational excellence 1+ years of experience working in intellectual property operations or trust and safety Experience moderating or responding to internal and external copyright related escalations and IP removals in an efficient manner Proven successful record in handling sensitive or confidential matters Strong attention to detail, highly self-driven and results oriented Proven ability to assess risk and impact Experience working cross functionally with a variety of stakeholders in a fast-paced environment Able to address sensitive content issues, including but not limited to graphic images, videos and writings, offensive or derogatory language, child safety, and other potentially objectionable material Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or above Experience in quality analysis in the content moderation/trust & safety industry Passionate and willing to work in the digital media and entertainment industry TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at recruiting.corp@tiktok.com Job Information The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $62400 - $124344 annually. ​ Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units. ​ At ByteDance/TikTok our benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support ByteDancers to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees: ​ We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care. ​ Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off(PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability. ​ We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

Quality Analyst, Law Enforcement Response - USDS - job post TikTok (part of ByteDance) 99 reviews Los Angeles, CA $62,400 - $124,344 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $62,400 - $124,344 a year Job Type Full-time Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. About USDS At TikTok, we're committed to a process of continuous innovation and improvement in our user experience and safety controls. We're proud to be able to serve a global community of more than a billion people who use TikTok to creatively express themselves and be entertained, and we're dedicated to giving them a platform that builds opportunity and fosters connection. We also take our responsibility to safeguard our community seriously, both in how we address potentially harmful content and how we protect against unauthorized access to user data. U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a standalone department of TikTok in the U.S. This new security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and user data in the U.S., so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained. The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more. Accounts Payable/ Receivable Analyst (Cannabis Testing Lab) - job post Encore Labs LLC Pasadena, CA 91107 $21 - $28 an hour -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $21 - $28 an hour Job Type Full-time Job Summary The Staff Accountant will maintain financial records and reports, perform account reconciliations, assist with close processes, conduct internal audits, and maintain accounts receivable and payable processes. The role will also be assisting the Accounting Manager in responding to information requests by management and other departments. The role will analyze past financial information to generate reporting on future performance. About the company Encore Labs is a licensed and ISO 17205 accredited cannabis testing laboratory, offering full-service testing aimed at guaranteeing the quality and compliance standards of all cannabis products. At Encore, we strive to improve our scientific innovation in both laboratory efficiency and research & development. General Duties Daily maintenance of full cycle AR and AP processes including but not limited to Billing, Collections, AP entry, sales ledger and data management, account reconciliations and cash management. Prepare accounting journal entries including accruals, reclassification entries and other month-end close tasks. Perform internal audits of Sales and Expense processes and make recommendations as needed. Analysis of business and financial data relating to sales and costs trends, market trends and other ad-hoc analysis. Create financial reporting to support forecasting and organizational decision making. Develop reporting and forecasting tools for more efficient use of data. Ensure compliance with GAAP in accounting and financial reporting. Other ad-hoc responsibilities as needed. Qualifications Must be at least 21 years of age. Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field preferred. Knowledge of the Balance Sheet, Profit and Loss and Cash Flow Statements. Two years of professional experience as a financial analyst, accountant, auditor, or computer programmer analyst. Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Office Suite, QuickBooks Online, or similar accounting systems. Comfort and ability to work autonomously or with minimal guidance. Solid organizational skills with the ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with solid attention to detail. Strong analytical and data gathering skills. Benefits/Compensation 401(k) Health insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision) Life Insurance Paid time off, Holidays, Sick pay Physical Setting Office Schedule Monday to Friday Work Location One location: Pasadena, CA Work Remotely No Encore Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual’s race, color, religion, age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status or disability. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $21.00 - $28.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Physical setting: Office Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Pasadena, CA 91107: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Application Question(s): Are you 21 years of age or or older? Work Location: One location Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Quality Assurance Patient Service Center Analyst - job post AltaMed Health Services Corporation 370 reviews Anaheim, CA 92805 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview: The Patient Service Center Quality Assurance Analyst supports all analytic efforts of the contact center by providing analytical, research and report development by mining, extracting and utilizing appropriate data from contact center systems. Develops analytic reports on a regular and ad-hoc basis that assist in identifying areas of performance improvement and providing recommendations for efficiencies. This position is also responsible for supporting workforce management setup, scheduling, analysis, forecasting, etc. to ensure internal and external service levels commitments are achieved. Responsibilities: Direct monitoring of call quality through automated analyzer in InIn QA software. To include voice/chat/screen capture and other communication. In coordination with Training Specialist and Supervisors Schedules and coordinates training to address gaps in call quality and errors. Manages and adjusts call campaigns for HEDIS measures to ensure effectiveness. Develop and design of departmental reports for individual and unit performance metrics. Recommend and participate in process improvement initiatives. Create outbound call campaigns to support HEDIS/Retention and New patient activity Prepare QA analytical reports in regards to Patient Service Center operations on a monthly basis and as requested by members of management. Develops and monitors agent calls that ensure a high level of customer service standards. Supports contact center management and staff with ad-hoc and routine reporting. Determines measures, baselines, tolerances and normal variability for indicators. Able to articulate these concepts and parameters for data presented. Formats QA and HEDIS data into user friendly presentations complete with definitions and explanations of collection methods. Performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field required. A minimum of four years’ experience required working in a contact center environment coupled with a minimum of one year workforce management experience. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
